metadata.Title: CVE-2022-25309 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A heap-based buffer overflow flaw was found in the Fribidi package and affects the fribidi_cap_rtl_to_unicode() function of the fribidi-char-sets-cap-rtl.c file. This flaw allows an attacker to pass a specially crafted file to the Fribidi application with the '--caprtl' option, leading to a crash and causing a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25309` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libfribidi-bin - 0.19.7-2ubuntu0.1
libfribidi0 - 0.19.7-2ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: rayveldkamp> For bionic affected function is in charset/fribidi-char-sets-cap-rtl.c

criterions.comment: fribidi package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.19.7-2ubuntu0.1').
